metadata.Title: CVE-2016-0798 on Ubuntu 14.04 ESM (trusty) - low
metadata.Description:
Memory leak in the SRP_VBASE_get_by_user implementation in OpenSSL 1.0.1before 1.0.1s and 1.0.2 before 1.0.2g allows remote attackers to cause adenial of service (memory consumption) by providing an invalid username ina connection attempt, related to apps/s_server.c and crypto/srp/srp_vfy.c.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2016-0798` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

libssl1.0.0 - 1.0.1f-1ubuntu2.18
openssl - 1.0.1f-1ubuntu2.18
Available with Ubuntu Pro (Infra-only): https://ubuntu.com/pro

criterions.comment: openssl package in trusty/esm was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '1.0.1f-1ubuntu2.18').
